question: Which of the following is also known as the "1958 Iraqi coup d'etat"?
explanation: The 14 July Revolution, also known as the 1958 Iraqi coup d'etat, took place on 14 July 1958 in Iraq and resulted in the overthrow of the Hashemite monarchy in Iraq that had been established by King Faisal I in 1921 under the auspices of the British. King Faisal II, Prince Abd al-Ilah, and Prime Minister Nuri al-Said were killed during the uprising. As a result of the overthrow of the Iraqi Hashemite dynasty, the coup d'etat established the Iraqi Republic.
